translation.en: [reporter] Have you heard about Kai, the hitchhiking hatchet hero?
translation.ko: 손도끼를 휘두른 히치하이커 영웅 카이를 아십니까?

translation.en: If you haven't, you will.
It's the hottest video on the Internet right now.
-What do you wanna talk about? -What happened?
translation.ko: - 뭐가 궁금한데요? - 아까 어떻게 된 거죠?

translation.en: [reporter] This was not a typical news story.
It may have started out as one,
but it very quickly progressed into a heck of a lot more.
I mean, there's no doubt that day Kai was a hero.
Everyone around the world wanted a piece of this kid.
translation.ko: 전 세계 사람들이 이 젊은이에 대해 알고 싶어 했죠

translation.en: He could have had anything he wanted.
translation.ko: 카이는 원하는 걸 다 가질 수 있었어요

translation.en: I mean, he could have had the money, the fame.
But this dude that I introduced the world to
translation.ko: 하지만 제가 세상에 알렸던 이 녀석은

translation.en: went, in the matter of three months,
from this amazing, heroic, beautiful person
to wanted by authorities for murder.
translation.ko: 경찰에 쫓기는 살인 용의자로 전락하고 말았어요

translation.en: -So it's a really fucked-up story. -[phone vibrating]
He's calling right now.
-[woman] Who is? -Kai.
-Hello? -[robotic voice] You have a prepaid call.
You will not be charged for this call.
This call is from an inmate at the New Jersey State Prison.
This call will be monitored and recorded.
[reporter 2] When we began to hear about this next story in the newsroom
translation.ko: 이어서 전해드릴 뉴스를 보도국에서 처음 접한 건

translation.en: a little after 2:00 p.m. this afternoon,
it sounded very strange.
And, as KMPH news anchor Jessob Reisbeck shows us,
it only got crazier.
[Jessob] It's February 1st 2013.
I had been tabbed to report news that day.
translation.ko: 그날 뉴스는 제가 보도하기로 돼 있었죠 "제섭 라이즈벡"

translation.en: And over the scanner came,
translation.ko: 경찰 무전 스캐너에서 이런 내용을 들었어요

translation.en: "There's been a car accident. It looks pretty bad."
"There's someone pinned between the car and a utility vehicle."
"The driver's yelling crazy things."
"'I'm Jesus Christ." "All Black people deserve to die.'"
Racist things. Terrible things.
An absolute bizarre scene here in West Fresno
at the corner of McKinley and Marks.
I was a sports anchor and reporter,
translation.ko: 전 스포츠 담당 앵커 겸 기자였는데

translation.en: and, for whatever reason, we were short on news reporters.
So this was literally my first day covering news,
and it turned out to be,
man, something else.
A man plows his car into a PG&E worker,
translation.ko: 한 남자가 가스 공사 작업자가 흑인이란 이유로

translation.en: pinning him against his truck, because the worker was Black.
translation.ko: 자신의 차량으로 작업자를 치는 바람에 작업자가 차에 끼었고

translation.en: And innocent bystanders come to the rescue.
He must have done this on purpose. Like, he tried to kill this dude.
My mom ran to the driver to make sure he was okay
'cause we thought maybe it was just an accident.
He just kept saying he was Jesus Christ
and he's gonna save all of us and that, but we have to get…
He used the N word, meaning the Black people and that. He said we need to get them off of the earth.
translation.ko: 흑인 비하 단어를 쓰면서 흑인을 이 땅에서 제거해야 한댔죠

translation.en: [Jessob] The driver ends up being this 6'4", 300-pound huge guy.
Then he turns to this woman that tried to come and help
translation.ko: 그 사내는 도와주러 온 여성을 향하더니

translation.en: and starts to physically hurt her, got her in a bear hug, is choking her.
translation.ko: 꼼짝 못 하게 끌어안고 목을 조르면서 공격했어요

translation.en: [Jessob] All of a sudden, she said the passenger,
translation.ko: 그 여성의 말로는 히치하이커나 노숙자처럼 보이는 행인 하나가

translation.en: who looked like a hitchhiker, a homeless guy,
comes and attacks the driver and saves her.
translation.ko: 갑자기 다가와 운전자를 공격해서 자기를 구했다는 거예요

translation.en: And, as I'm doing this interview,
I look across this two-lane farm road
and down walking on the other side of the road
was a guy with long hair, a bandana, a really big backpack,
translation.ko: 장발에 밴대나를 쓰고 커다란 배낭을 메고 있었죠

translation.en: and not to stereotype, but looked like a homeless hitchhiker.
translation.ko: 고정관념이긴 하지만 딱 노숙자 히치하이커 같았어요

translation.en: -Can we talk to you? Do you mind? -What do you wanna talk about?
What happened today?
Well, went straight outta Dogtown.
Skateboarding, surfing it up…
The first thing he wanted to do was send a loving message
translation.ko: 이 친구는 제일 먼저 모든 시청자에게 따뜻한 메시지를 전하고 싶댔어요

translation.en: to whoever sees this interview. It's powerful. It gives me goosebumps.
translation.ko: 모든 시청자에게 따뜻한 메시지를 전하고 싶댔어요 감동의 소름이 돋았죠

translation.en: He'd been through this crazy, what to most people would be a traumatic situation,
translation.ko: 웬만한 사람들에겐 충격이 됐을 황당한 일을 겪고도

translation.en: and he looked right in the camera…
Before I say anything else, I wanna say
no matter what you've done, you deserve respect.
translation.ko: 여태 어떻게 살았든 여러분은 존중받을 자격이 있어요

translation.en: Even if you make mistakes, you're lovable,
and it doesn't matter your looks, skills, or age, size, or anything,
translation.ko: 외모, 능력, 나이, 키랑 상관없이 여러분은 가치 있는 존재예요

translation.en: you're worthwhile. No one can ever take that away from you. Now…
translation.ko: 외모, 능력, 나이, 키랑 상관없이 여러분은 가치 있는 존재예요 그 가치는 누가 뭐래도 사라지지 않아요 됐어요

translation.en: He just had such a different perspective of what he was supposed to do in that moment.
translation.ko: 그 상황에서 자기가 할 말을 완전히 다른 관점으로 접근했죠

translation.en: [hitchhiker] I look over. The guy's pinned there.
Buddy gets out. These two women are trying to help him.
translation.ko: 그 덩치가 차에서 내리고 여자 둘이 도와주러 오는데

translation.en: He runs up, and he grabs one of them, man.
translation.ko: 덩치가 달려들어서 여자 하나를 잡는 거예요

translation.en: A guy that big can snap a woman's neck like a pencil stick.
translation.ko: 하도 덩치가 커서 여자 목을 연필처럼 잡더라고요

translation.en: So I fucking ran up behind him with a hatchet.
translation.ko: 그래서 냅다 손도끼를 들고 뒤를 덮쳤죠

translation.en: Smash! Smash! Smash!
Yeah.
Who would expect a hatchet-wielding hitchhiker
to be coming to save the day?
I was blown away. Absolutely blown away,
'cause you looked at him and he's rough around the edges,
and then you see
translation.ko: "테리 우즈 촬영 기사" 마음은 보석 같은 친구란 걸 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: the treasure he truly was.
translation.ko: 마음은 보석 같은 친구란 걸 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: That woman was in danger.
He just finished, what looked like at the time, killing somebody.
translation.ko: 그 덩치가 방금 사람을 하나 죽인 것 같았고요

translation.en: If I hadn't done that, he would've killed more people.
translation.ko: 내가 구경만 했으면 사람이 더 죽어 나갔겠죠

translation.en: [woman] Did it strike you as odd that he had a hatchet?
Did it-- Not really. I mean, I just--
You know, I figured being kind of a homeless transient,
a hatchet would be a good thing to have, you know.
He saw a woman that was in danger. "I'm gonna help her."
translation.ko: 그 친구는 여자가 위험한 걸 보자마자 도우러 갔어요

translation.en: But how willing and able he was to use it on another person's skull,
translation.ko: 근데 남의 머리를 서슴없이 도끼로 쳤다는 건

translation.en: maybe, yeah. That's kinda shocking.
[Jessob] How'd you get in his car? I was… I was hitchhiking.
translation.ko: 그 사람 차에는 어쩌다 타게 됐죠? 난 히치하이커잖아요

translation.en: Well, good thing I was hitchhiking.
Yeah, people say, "Don't hitchhike. This is what happens."
-Yeah, well, at least I was here. -[Jessob] Can I get your name?
translation.ko: 오늘 나 없었으면 어쩔 뻔했어요? - 이름이 뭐죠? - 카이라고 해요

translation.en: -I'm Kai. -[Jessob] Can I get the spelling for it?
-Straight outta Dogtown. K-A-I. -[Jessob] Do you have a last name?
translation.ko: - 도그타운에서 온 K, A, I요 - 성은요?

translation.en: No, bro. I don't have anything.
As crazy as things got here, the best news is,
translation.ko: 끔찍한 사건이 벌어졌지만 다행히 좋은 소식도 있습니다

translation.en: somehow, luckily, none of the injuries suffered are life-threatening,
translation.ko: 다행히 좋은 소식도 있습니다 부상자 모두 생명에는 지장이 없는 상태이며

translation.en: and the guy driving that car is right where he belongs, in police custody.
translation.ko: 운전자는 가야 할 곳으로 갔습니다 경찰에 체포됐죠

translation.en: In West Fresno, Jessob Reisbeck, KMPH News.
translation.ko: 웨스트 프레즈노에서 KMPH 뉴스 제섭 라이즈벡입니다

translation.en: After I finished the interview, reporters from other stations came up to him.
translation.ko: 제가 인터뷰를 마친 후에 다른 방송국 기자들도 카이에게 다가가

translation.en: and said, of course, "Can we talk to you?"
This guy was the most charismatic dude ever.
He's gonna talk to everyone. He wants everyone to see him.
translation.ko: 여기저기 더 얘기하고 방송에 나가고 싶었을 법한데도

translation.en: For whatever reason, he said, "Nope. I'm not talking to anyone else," and left.
translation.ko: 웬일인지 인터뷰는 더 안 하겠다며 가버렸어요

translation.en: And when that happened, I knew.
Holy shit. We got something really special now,
because we're gonna be the only one with this interview.
When you look at a story, any story, if you're going to tell a story,
translation.ko: 이야기를 만들기 위해선 필요한 게 있죠

translation.en: you need a villain,
you need an unlikely hero,
you need an amazing scenario, and you need someone in distress,
translation.ko: 기가 막힌 각본이랑 위험에 빠진 사람이 있어야 하죠

translation.en: and this had all of that.
Yeah, it was fucking gnarly, man.
Holy shit. It was like the biggest wave I've ever ridden in my life.
We knew we had gold on our hands.
That night I decided I wanted the world to see the entire interview,
translation.ko: 그날 밤 작정했죠 이 인터뷰를 못 본 사람이 없게 만들자고요

translation.en: the six-plus minutes of interview,
because, up until this point, people had only been able to see
the minute-and-a-half piece that I'd put on the news.
So I put it on YouTube, I clicked "upload,"
and then I went to bed.
I woke up the next morning, and my world was different.
translation.ko: 다음 날 일어났더니 딴 세상이 돼 있더군요

translation.en: It was a game changer in my life, for sure, just uploading that video.
translation.ko: 그 동영상을 올린 게 저한테는 인생 역전의 계기였죠

translation.en: I had my own YouTube channel, and I had about 20 followers.
translation.ko: 저도 따로 유튜브 채널이 있는데 구독자가 20명 정도 됐어요

translation.en: And I put it up when I got home, and I looked at it that night,
translation.ko: 집에 와서 동영상을 올리고 밤에 확인했더니

translation.en: and it's like, "Oh, it's gotten about 20 hits."
translation.ko: 집에 와서 동영상을 올리고 밤에 확인했더니 조회 수가 20 정도 되길래

translation.en: "That's nice. That's average. Cool."
Jessob called me the next day. He's all, "Terry, dude!"
Just like, "Yeah, Jessob? What?"
He's like, "Have you seen your video?"
It's like, "Oh yeah, it was doing good. I think it was about at 20 or 30 people."
I thought it was good. He's like, "Dude, it's at, like, half a million."
translation.ko: 전 그대로도 만족이었는데 제섭이 50만이 넘었다는 거예요

translation.en: I knew that day
that Kai the Hatchet-Wielding Hitchhiker was born.
translation.ko: 손도끼를 휘두른 히치하이커 카이라는 스타가 탄생한 겁니다

translation.en: Now, this stuff right here, I was driving…
-Smash! Smash! Smash! -[laughs]
-Smash! -Smash!
He literally has a hatchet in his hand.
I'm absolutely obsessed with this guy.
This guy's my fucking hero!
Kai the Hatchet-Wielding Hitchhiker.
Fuck yeah.
Every time you would refresh,
someone else had taken the video and reposted it,
translation.ko: 동영상을 자기 계정에 공유하는 사람이 늘어났어요

translation.en: and that had tens or hundreds of thousands of views.
So it was just literally like a snowball that rolled and rolled,
and the Internet just fed into it.
♪ I'm Kai ♪
[Jessob] There's dozens and dozens of different autotunes and different songs.
translation.ko: 동영상엔 별의별 음성 편집 버전과 노래가 붙었고요

translation.en: It was insane.
♪ Smash, smash, smash! ♪
I mean, the memes? Gimme a break, dude. That guy is a walking meme.
translation.ko: 밈은 또 어떻고요, 말도 마요 카이는 걸어 다니는 밈 제조기였어요

translation.en: He might have started memes.
♪ People say, "Don't hitchhike" ♪
♪ Well, good thing I was hitchhiking ♪
♪ That woman was in danger ♪
♪ So I ran up behind him with a hatchet ♪
translation.ko: 그래서 냅다 손도끼를 들고 뒤를 덮쳤죠

translation.en: ♪ Smash, smash, smash! ♪
♪ Yeah, yeah ♪
♪ If he'd started driving that car again ♪
♪ There'd be a hell of a lot Of bodies around here ♪
♪ Dude, that guy was fucking kooked ♪
♪ He can snap a woman's neck Like a pencil stick ♪
translation.ko: 하도 덩치가 커서 여자 목을 연필처럼 잡더라고요

translation.en: ♪ So I started smashing him in the head ♪
♪ Smash, smash, smash! ♪
Axe-wielding hitchhikers.
I can't tell you how many times I've rolled up my windows
translation.ko: 한두 번이 아니에요 이제 일꾼이 손도끼 날을 가는 것만 보면

translation.en: and sped past a hobo sharpening a hatchet.
When I saw Stephen Colbert do his skit,
translation.ko: 스티븐 콜베어가 카이로 개그 하는 걸 봤어요

translation.en: I mean, I didn't watch Colbert that much until then,
translation.ko: 사실 그전까진 콜베어 쇼를 자주 안 봤는데

translation.en: and then I became an instant fan of his show. [chuckles]
For the first time in human history, people are saying,
translation.ko: 살다 보니 이런 말을 다 듣게 되네요

translation.en: "Boy, we sure are lucky
that homeless hitchhiker was carrying a hatchet."
Kai equalled ratings. It equalled ratings because he was fresh and interesting.
translation.ko: 카이는 시청률 보증 수표였죠 참신하고 재밌고 사람들이 좋아했으니까요

translation.en: People liked him, and ratings equal money.
translation.ko: 참신하고 재밌고 사람들이 좋아했으니까요 시청률은 곧 돈이라

translation.en: So everyone was wanting a piece of him, to jump on the Kai train, as it were.
translation.ko: 너도나도 카이를 이용해서 대세에 편승하려고 했어요

translation.en: My name is Brad Mulcahy.
In 2013, I was the human interest researcher
for the late-night television show Jimmy Kimmel Live.
[announcer] Ready or not, here's Jimmy Kimmel!
[Brad] My job is to find interesting stories
or interesting clips and bring them to rehearsal or email them to Jimmy
translation.ko: 재미난 얘깃거리나 동영상을 찾아서 리허설 때나 이메일로 지미에게 전달하거나

translation.en: or to track down what Jimmy likes.
translation.ko: 지미의 관심사를 조사하는 게 내 일이었죠

translation.en: Then I try to find that person to get them on within 36 hours.
translation.ko: 화제의 주인공을 찾아내서 36시간 이내에 출연을 섭외하는 일도 했고요

translation.en: We tend to air things that are funny.
Leave Britney alone!
We especially like people who are genuine
and whose reaction to something unexpected is genuine.
translation.ko: 뜻밖의 이슈에 진심 어린 반응을 보이는 사람을 선호했어요

translation.en: And the best example that I can think of at the moment is Paul Vasquez,
translation.ko: 적당한 예로는 폴 바스케스가 딱 떠오르는데요

translation.en: who was the double rainbow guy.
So this gentleman is in Yosemite Park,
and one day in the park, he's filming a rainbow,
translation.ko: 어느 날 무지개를 촬영하게 된 사람인데요

translation.en: and as he's filming it, a second rainbow begins.
translation.ko: 동영상을 찍는 동안 또 다른 무지개가 뜬 거예요

translation.en: [Paul] Whoa! My God! Oh my God!
[laughs] Oh my God! Whoo!
And at that point, it only had tens of thousands of views.
translation.ko: 그때만 해도 조회 수가 몇만 정도였어요

translation.en: And then once we get him on the show, it went up over 45 million.
translation.ko: 근데 우리 쇼에 출연하고서 조회 수가 4천5백만으로 뛰었죠

translation.en: Were you or were you not ingesting or inhaling some sort of illegal substance when you made that--
translation.ko: 혹시 촬영할 때 불법적인 약물을 섭취하거나 흡입했나요?

translation.en: Absolutely not. I was completely sober. In that video.
translation.ko: 절대 아니에요, 말짱했어요 그거 찍을 때는요

translation.en: The first time I saw the video of Kai, it was intoxicating,
translation.ko: 처음 카이 동영상을 봤는데 볼수록 빠져들게 되더라고요

translation.en: not to mention that he did genuinely help two human beings who were in peril.
translation.ko: 위험에 처한 두 사람을 실제로 구한 것도 대단하고요

translation.en: And it was brilliant.
I went to rehearsal, and I believe I was told almost immediately,
"We'd like to see if you can find that gentleman."
Hey, buddy! Good boy.
Who's a good boy, baby?
Of course everybody wants to be famous, but who has that "it factor"?
translation.ko: 누구나 유명해지길 꿈꾸지만 성공하려면 '잇 팩터'란 게 필요해요

translation.en: What is that thing that is just so mesmerizing
that you can't take your eyes off somebody,
that is, like… "What are they gonna do next?"
One of the biggest shows that I had the privilege of working on
translation.ko: 참여해서 정말 뿌듯했고 대성공을 거둔 작품으로

translation.en: was Keeping Up with the Kardashians.
[announcer] Don't miss the season premiere of The Kardashians.
And I think the appeal with Kai was,
most people that are heroes are not homeless people.
This was somebody that came from a different walk of life
translation.ko: 카이는 전혀 다른 종류의 삶을 살아 온 사람이라

translation.en: that could just open up new audiences
and expose people to a different world that they had never seen.
translation.ko: 이전엔 한 번도 보지 못한 세상을 보여줄 수 있었어요

translation.en: And there was something funny about him and kinda cute and sweet and innocent.
translation.ko: 재밌기도 하고, 귀엽고 다감하면서 순진한 면도 있었죠

translation.en: If anyone's watching this and they got a Mini Mal that they could lend a guy
translation.ko: 이거 보는 분 중에 '미니 말' 서프보드랑 웨트슈트를 빌려줄 분 있으면

translation.en: with a wetsuit, I'd love to test out Mavericks.
translation.ko: '미니 말' 서프보드랑 웨트슈트를 빌려줄 분 있으면 매버릭스에서 서핑해 보고 싶어요

translation.en: He has that "it factor."
So I wanna find him.
Except how do you find someone that's homeless?
translation.ko: 근데 집 없는 사람을 무슨 수로 찾는다죠?

translation.en: [Lisa] Where to start, right?
I mean, wow!
My first move was going onto Facebook,
and Kai had a profile, so I added him
and sent him a message that, you know, I wanted to find him
and I was at this production company.
What's step one?
I don't know.
And that's when I called the Fresno affiliate that aired the clip.
translation.ko: 인터뷰를 방송한 프레즈노의 방송국에 연락해 봤죠

translation.en: I speak to Jessob. It's like, "How do I get in touch with this guy?"
translation.ko: 카이에게 연락할 방법이 없는지 제섭한테 물어봤더니

translation.en: And Jessob, you know, "You can't."
Jessob was the gatekeeper.
Everyone around the world wanted a piece of this kid.
translation.ko: 전 세계 사람들이 카이에 대해 알고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: At one point, I remember deleting my emails.
Six minutes later,
six minutes, I had, like, 124 emails
from people in Japan, Australia,
East Coast, West Coast,
all the different talk shows you can imagine.
translation.ko: 세상 모든 토크쇼에서 다 이메일을 보내왔었죠

translation.en: I knew they wanted to talk to him, to be the first person to tell his story.
translation.ko: 다들 카이를 만나 최초로 카이를 소개하는 당사자가 되려고 안달이었어요

translation.en: But I also knew I was the only one with his email.
translation.ko: 하지만 카이의 이메일을 아는 건 나뿐이었죠

translation.en: So I sent him a message, and I just told him,
look, there's all these people that wanna literally make him rich and famous,
translation.ko: 당신을 스타로 만들어 주려는 사람들이 넘쳐난다

translation.en: but I wanted to be the first one before all these opportunities.
translation.ko: 당신에겐 기회가 널렸지만 내가 1번 타자가 되고 싶다

translation.en: I wanted to tell him about these opportunities
in an honest, fair way.
Subject, "Blowing Up."
"Hey bro, we'd love to do an interview with you
about all the craziness going on around the Internet and the world about you."
translation.ko: '전 세계 온라인과 오프라인이 당신 때문에 난리잖아요'

translation.en: "The people wanna hear from you."
"We'd love to be the one that brings it to them."
"Hope all is good."
"Stay safe."
Everybody was trying to get a hold of him. I mean, this was a manhunt.
translation.ko: 다들 눈에 불을 켜고 카이를 찾고 있었어요 거의 수색 작전 수준이었죠

translation.en: As this thing is getting bigger and bigger and bigger,
I knew that I had to talk to him again. I had to figure out more about him.
translation.ko: 어떻게든 카이를 다시 만나 더 알아봐야겠다고 생각했어요

translation.en: I had to tell his story.
Finally, he used someone's phone at a gas station and called me.
translation.ko: 마침내 카이가 주유소에서 폰을 빌려 연락해 왔어요

translation.en: I was super stoked.
And then I said, "Where are you, and when can we come and talk to you?"
translation.ko: 지금 어디에 있는지 언제 만날 수 있는지 물어봤더니

translation.en: And he said something like, "Oh, well, you know, I'm up in Stockton."
Um, and even my boss said, "Do whatever you have to do."
translation.ko: 심지어 제 상사도 할 수 있는 건 다 해보랬죠

translation.en: "Get the kid a hotel room. Keep him somewhere so we can talk to him."
translation.ko: 호텔을 잡아주든가 해서 연락되는 데 잡아두라고요

translation.en: [man] Anytime you're on the road getting ready to interview somebody,
translation.ko: 인터뷰 찍으러 이동할 때면 늘 기대감으로 들떠요

translation.en: you get excited. But I think this was a little bit more excitement
translation.ko: 인터뷰 찍으러 이동할 때면 늘 기대감으로 들떠요 이번엔 유난히 더 설렜죠

translation.en: because this is a guy that has gone viral, that everybody wants a piece of.
translation.ko: 인터넷에서 화제가 됐고 "앨릭스 아기레 촬영 기사" 다들 만나고 싶어 하는 사람이었으니까요

translation.en: But nobody could get a hold of him except for one person in the entire world.
translation.ko: 하지만 카이에게 연락되는 건 전 세계에서 단 한 명뿐이었죠

translation.en: And that was Jessob.
[Jessob] The entire drive there, I was talking to different people, doing different interviews.
translation.ko: 가는 내내 차 안에서 여러 사람과 통화하고 인터뷰를 했어요

translation.en: It's nonstop. They're trying to get him. "I'm going to talk to him."
translation.ko: 숨 쉴 틈도 없었어요 카이를 찾으려 안달인 사람들한테 곧 만난다고 했더니

translation.en: They wanna know where. I'm not telling them.
We were driving up to the hotel,
and I'm turning the corner, and I turn to Jessob. I was like,
"Isn't that Kai?" Jessob's like…
"There he is. Turn around. Let's go. We're getting him."
Uh, yeah, let's do this, in three...
Look who it is! We finally caught up with him.
It is the world sensation,
everybody's friend, and pretty much a world hero,
translation.ko: 세계적인 관심의 초점이자 만인의 친구 세계적인 영웅이라 해도 과언이 아닌 카이입니다

translation.en: it's Kai. Kai, let me tell you this real quick.
translation.ko: 세계적인 영웅이라 해도 과언이 아닌 카이입니다 일단 이 말부터 할게요

translation.en: You're like Batman, except for you don't have the Bat-Signal.
translation.ko: 당신은 배트맨 같아요 배트 시그널은 없지만요

translation.en: You know, Batman obviously has the spotlight--
And I'm not a filthy rich, spoiled fuck who looks down on everyone.
translation.ko: 난 돈이 더럽게 많지도 않고 사람들 개무시하는 싸가지 없는 새끼 아닌데요

translation.en: [Alex] I think the biggest difference between seeing him in the viral video
translation.ko: 실제로 만나본 카이는 바이럴 영상으로 보던 것과는 많이 달랐는데요

translation.en: and being around him in person was that he was a loose cannon.
translation.ko: 바이럴 영상으로 보던 것과는 많이 달랐는데요 언제 터질지 모르는 폭탄 같았죠

translation.en: I felt like his energy was just a little bit crazy, you know?
He just had some weird energy around him
that was, like, you didn't know what he was gonna do next.
-You can bleep that, right? -That was awesome.
The first one-- Okay…
He had such an endearing quality. There's so much charisma.
translation.ko: 카이에겐 사람 마음을 끄는 매력과 카리스마가 있었어요

translation.en: I don't know if I've met someone that has as much charisma as this guy.
translation.ko: 그만큼 카리스마 있는 사람은 흔치 않아요

translation.en: This right here is one of my friends.
Her name's Joan Sewitt.
Now, on Saturday here,
some of these, uh… some of these policy enforcers up on over in…
This is Stockton.
They came on up with her with a gun.
translation.ko: 그 사람들이 총을 들고 조앤한테 다가왔어요

translation.en: Like, they pulled a gun on her.
That, to me, is fucking ridiculous. That is a vulgar display of power,
translation.ko: 겁나 어이 상실이죠 천박한 힘의 과시였어요

translation.en: and not in a way that I think Phil Anselmo would appreciate.
He would fill a cart from a local store with goods and steal it.
translation.ko: 카이는 근처 가게에서 훔친 물건을 카트에 담고

translation.en: But he would go outside and give it all away to people that needed it.
So it's like, "Well, shit. I don't even know how to look at that."
translation.ko: 이 상황을 어떻게 받아들여야 하나 싶더라고요

translation.en: How did it make you feel, though, being this viral sensation,
translation.ko: 인터넷에서 폭발적인 인기를 얻게 된 소감이 어떤가요?

translation.en: being everyone's hero right now, Kai?
I'm not a virus. You kidding me?
Shit, I'm a sensation. I'm Kai.
We did the interview first, and then we need what's called B-roll.
translation.ko: 일차로 인터뷰를 했고 중간중간 편집해 넣을 B롤 영상이 필요했어요

translation.en: "So what do you think would be a good shot of you?"
And he said, "There's a music shop over here."
"I can grab one of the guitars and play a song." We're like, "Sweet."
translation.ko: 기타 치고 노래를 하겠대요 좋다고 했죠

translation.en: So here's one I wrote.
[Jessob] He plays this song, and it was phenomenal.
♪ I've never seen a beauty Like you before ♪
♪ Breathless kisses through the door ♪
translation.ko: 문을 통해 숨 막히는 키스를 보내

translation.en: ♪ You got that shiny light Of fight in your eyes ♪
translation.ko: 네 눈 속엔 반짝이며 날아가는 빛이 있어

translation.en: ♪ You're the sunset That brings the twilight ♪
♪ Soft, orange kisses, forlorn misses ♪
translation.ko: 부드러운 주홍빛 키스 놓쳐서 더 쓸쓸한 것들

translation.en: ♪ When you leave ♪
♪ Soft, orange kisses, well-worn dresses ♪
translation.ko: 부드러운 주홍빛 키스 잘 어울리는 원피스

translation.en: ♪ That you leave ♪
[Jessob] Performed well, sung well.
The guitar playing was great.
You know, he even, like, performs it, you know?
At one point, the song says something like, you know,
"Take back your hood,"
and he, like, throws his bandana off at the perfect time.
translation.ko: 근데 카이가 완벽한 타이밍에 쓰고 있던 밴대나를 벗었어요

translation.en: ♪ Pull back my hood And kiss me real good ♪
translation.ko: 내 모자를 벗겨 줘 진하게 키스해 줘

translation.en: ♪ And just move Get a little bit closer ♪
♪ And pull back, and pull back, you do ♪
♪ And just move ♪
♪ We'll feel this groove With the loving that we do ♪
translation.ko: 우리 사랑이 만드는 이 그루브를 느낄 거야

translation.en: ♪ We'll feel this groove With the loving that we do, uh ♪
translation.ko: 우리 사랑이 만드는 이 그루브를 느낄 거야

translation.en: He's a great performer, and he's talented as heck.
Wow, this is another, you know, aspect of this guy that's pretty incredible.
translation.ko: 그 친구의 또 다른 놀라운 면을 보게 됐어요

translation.en: He's willing to be a hero in a dangerous situation.
translation.ko: 위험한 상황에서 기꺼이 영웅 역할을 한 데다

translation.en: And he's also a really good musician.
-[Jessob] How do you know this guy? -The Internet, man.
He, uh… he hit some guy with an axe in the head.
He didn't know the scope of it at that point,
about how, you know, big his story had become.
translation.ko: 자기 얘기가 어느 정도까지 유명한지 감이 없었죠

translation.en: He was starting to see it
because, I mean, people were already recognizing him
and asking him for pictures and autographs and stuff like that.
translation.ko: 같이 사진을 찍자거나 사인해 달라고 했거든요

translation.en: How'd you get up here?
Uh, hitchhiked. [chuckles]
-Sweet. -Yeah, bro.
-Hope you still have the hatchet. -No, I don't. They took it from me.
translation.ko: 손도끼는 잘 있죠? 이제 없어요 사람들이 가져갔거든요

translation.en: Oh, we need to get you a new hatchet, sir.
[Jessob] So we finished up filming, and then I said,
translation.ko: 촬영을 끝내고 뭐 좀 먹겠냐고 물으니까

translation.en: "Do you wanna eat?" He says, "I'll come and eat."
I just started laying out the options that he had,
everyone from East Coast to West Coast, then Jimmy Kimmel,
translation.ko: 미국 전역의 모든 토크쇼에 지미 키멀까지

translation.en: and the fricking Kardashian producers wanna give him his own show.
translation.ko: 무려 '카다시안 쇼'의 프로듀서들도 카이가 주인공인 프로를 만들고 싶어 한다고요

translation.en: "Kai, he's trying to say you're famous now."
And you could see the lights kinda click on in Kai's head,
translation.ko: 카이의 머릿속에서 뭔가 잠시 반짝 하는 것 같았어요

translation.en: like, "Whoa, like, I'm famous. Like, what?"
I mean, there is no bigger brand than the Kardashians.
I could turn around and throw a dart and approach anybody
translation.ko: 난 길 가는 아무나 찍어서 접근한 다음에

translation.en: and entice them to wanna be a reality star.
translation.ko: 리얼리티쇼 스타로 키워 준다며 꼬실 수 있는 사람이에요

translation.en: He could be rich and famous and do anything he wants
translation.ko: 카이는 갑부에 유명인에 원하는 건 뭐든 될 수 있었어요

translation.en: if he wants it.
There were these comment cards on the table,
and they had, like, a little golf pencil with them.
And he's kind of playing with the pencil as I'm talking to him.
translation.ko: 내가 얘기하는데 계속 그 연필로 장난을 치더라고요

translation.en: I'm like, "Kai, are you listening to me?"
translation.ko: 카이한테 지금 제대로 듣는 거냐고 물었죠

translation.en: "Listen to all these things I'm telling you."
"This is unbelievable. You could be an overnight millionaire."
translation.ko: '믿을 수 없는 기회예요 갑부 되는 건 시간 문제라고요'

translation.en: He just continues to play with this pencil.
translation.ko: 근데도 카이는 계속 연필로 장난을 치면서

translation.en: He's like, "I kinda just want to go to the Bay Area and smoke weed."
translation.ko: 베이 지역에 가서 대마초나 피우고 싶다는 거예요

translation.en: All of the things in the world on one side,
smoke weed on the other side.
This is the fork in the road we've come to with Kai.
translation.ko: 카이는 그 두 갈림길에 서 있었던 겁니다

translation.en: And all of a sudden, he picks it up, throws it,
and it spins around and it falls,
and he looks at me, and he goes,
"I'm gonna go to the Bay Area and smoke weed."
"Are you… kidding me right now? Wait a second."
"You're telling me that he is not gonna meet with us
because he spun some pencil?"
I mean, you have to think if you're Kai, like,
"What do I have to lose?"
"This has to change my life somehow. Why not?"
translation.ko: '이번 기회에 새 인생을 살아보는 것도 좋겠지'

translation.en: "Hey, just go back to him and say
we'll send him a whole limo filled with weed."
"Look, dude, here's their counter-offer."
Kai said, "Okay."
Alex and I jump in our news vehicle,
translation.ko: 앨릭스랑 난 보도 차량에서 신바람이 나서

translation.en: and we head back to Fresno with the story that we got.
KMPH is still the only TV station in the world to talk to Kai,
translation.ko: KMPH는 아직도 카이를 인터뷰한 유일한 방송국입니다만

translation.en: but he is getting offers for new television adventures,
translation.ko: 카이가 새로운 TV 프로에 출연을 제의받고 있다고 합니다

translation.en: like, well, you wouldn't believe.
So chances are you will be seeing him somewhere new very soon.
translation.ko: 조만간 새로운 방송에서 카이를 보시게 될 것 같군요

translation.en: At this point, everybody wants to get a hold of Kai,
so Jessob says, "Hey, listen. Kai's willing to do something with you,
translation.ko: 제섭이 이런 말을 했어요 '카이가 당신이랑 프로그램을 할 마음이 있대요'

translation.en: but also The Kimmel Show wants him."
"So, hey, that's gotta be good for us. Like, we're really onto something."
translation.ko: 우리한테도 득이 되겠다 싶었죠 뭔가 일이 되는 분위기였어요

translation.en: "If the guy that we wanna make a show with is then gonna be on Kimmel,
translation.ko: 우리가 쇼를 만들려는 사람이 키멀 쇼에 나간다면

translation.en: it can only make him more popular, so that's gotta be good for us."
translation.ko: 인기가 더 높아질 테고 그럼 우리도 좋은 일이니까요

translation.en: We couldn't put him on the train,
translation.ko: 카이는 기차도, 비행기도 탈 수 없었어요

translation.en: we couldn't put him on a plane because he has no ID.
translation.ko: 카이는 기차도, 비행기도 탈 수 없었어요 신분증이 없었거든요

translation.en: So somebody has to put hands on this guy
and then drive him 500 miles.
So we're bringing him to the show,
translation.ko: 우리가 카이를 쇼 촬영장에 데려오기로 했어요

translation.en: and my boss said, "We're sending JR with you."
"He knows Northern California."
[JR] I had no idea who this Kai guy was.
So I watched the viral YouTube video,
and I realized, gosh, I guess he's got some endearing qualities,
but he also just made the news
for bludgeoning somebody over the head with a deadly weapon.
This is gonna be interesting.
It seems most reality production companies
are looking for the next big pop-culture icon to emerge,
translation.ko: 대중문화의 차세대 아이콘이 나타나길 기대하고 있었어요

translation.en: and after Simple Life with Paris Hilton went away,
they needed a new Paris Hilton, and Kim Kardashian became that.
translation.ko: 새로운 패리스 힐튼이 필요했고 킴 카다시안이 그 자리를 채웠어요

translation.en: So it's a constant look for the next big thing.
translation.ko: 제작사들은 계속해서 다음 대세를 찾고 있었죠

translation.en: Kai had communicated with Jessob
that he had hitchhiked his way down to Santa Rosa.
And, uh, here we go. Giddy up.
400,000 more of me.
And then there's all the ones who are just struggling to get up,
translation.ko: 그리고 일어나는 것도 힘든 사람들이 있지만

translation.en: but we're helping them.
My initial impression is, oh my God, he smelled of alcohol.
This guy is in-tox-i-cated.
First thing he does is he sees some guy who looked like he "had less than he did."
translation.ko: 카이가 처음 한 일은 어떤 남자를 보고 '나보다 없어 보인다'면서

translation.en: He takes the backpack off his back, and he gave him the backpack.
translation.ko: 메고 있던 배낭을 내려서 그대로 그 사람한테 준 거예요

translation.en: You know, I thought, like, wow. Okay, that's pretty good.
[JR] Kimmel's gonna do his thing. That'll just be a one-off.
What we need to make sure that we do,
translation.ko: 우린 카이 일을 확실하게 처리해야 했어요

translation.en: before anybody else in Hollywood can get their grubby hands on him,
translation.ko: 할리우드의 누군가가 카이에게 마수를 뻗치기 전에 말이죠

translation.en: "Here's the contract. Sign here."
And I remember that he signed it in hieroglyphics.
translation.ko: 내 기억으로 카이는 서명을 상형 문자로 했어요

translation.en: It took him ten minutes to sign his name, and it was just gibberish.
translation.ko: 서명하는 데 10분이 걸렸는데 무슨 말인지 알아볼 수가 없었죠

translation.en: I don't know how else to describe it. It was like a cave drawing.
translation.ko: 딱히 표현할 말을 모르겠는데 동굴 벽화 같았어요

translation.en: That was his "signature" agreeing to be on the show.
translation.ko: 그게 TV 출연에 동의하는 카이의 서명이었어요

translation.en: So theoretically I guess we had our "deal."
Mission accomplished.
[Lisa] We weren't really sure exactly what this show was gonna be,
translation.ko: 구체적으로 어떤 쇼를 만들지는 정하지 못한 상태였지만

translation.en: but I think what people saw at my company
was that Kai could be a gateway into a world that we never saw.
translation.ko: 카이라는 관문을 통해 우리가 전혀 몰랐던 세상을 보게 되길 기대했던 거 같아요

translation.en: Homeless people living happily on the streets.
The show would be batshit crazy, I know that!
translation.ko: 말도 안 되는 프로그램이 될 거라 확신했어요

translation.en: If Kai is, like, the lead man, it's gonna be nuts.
[Jessob] I remember telling her, "Look, get ready."
"This is not easy."
"He's a great guy, and he's a crazy guy,
but it's not unicorns and rainbows when you hang out with this guy."
translation.ko: 카이를 상대하는 건 마냥 즐겁기만 한 게 아니거든요

translation.en: "It is exhausting. It's hard. So just be ready."
translation.ko: 피곤하고 힘들 테니 마음의 준비를 하랬죠

translation.en: "And if you need me, call me. Whatever I can do…"
"Give me the phone. I'll talk to him if anything's going on."
translation.ko: 문제가 생기면 내가 카이랑 얘기해 보겠다고 했죠

translation.en: [Brad] It's eight o'clock, and I'm standing outside
the Roosevelt Hotel on Hollywood Boulevard.
Lisa pulls up with Kai,
and I see Lisa for the first time,
and I see Kai for the first time.
And Lisa looks down, and she says,
"Can you watch him for a minute? I'm gonna go valet the car,"
translation.ko: '발레파킹 맡기고 올 테니 잠깐만 카이를 봐줄래요?'

translation.en: which is just straight around the corner, and I say, "No problem."
translation.ko: 코너만 돌면 발레 부스라 걱정 말라고 했어요

translation.en: And Kai, he gets out of the car. It's me and him on Hollywood Boulevard,
translation.ko: 카이가 차에서 내렸고 할리우드 대로에 둘이 있게 됐죠

translation.en: and people are recognizing him almost immediately.
People are driving by, and they're saying, "Smash! Smash! Smash!"
translation.ko: 차를 몰고 지나가던 사람들도 '강타, 강타, 강타!'를 외쳤어요

translation.en: So I'm just standing there. I'm not watching him. He's an adult.
translation.ko: 굳이 카이를 지켜보진 않았어요 다 큰 어른이잖아요

translation.en: Lisa comes back around the corner,
and I could see her, and she looks at me and she stops.
translation.ko: 굳은 표정으로 날 보면서 걸음을 멈추더라고요

translation.en: Kai has his pants pulled down…
And he's urinating on Julio Iglesias's star
translation.ko: 훌리오 이글레시아스의 별에다 오줌을 싸고 있었죠

translation.en: directly in front of this hotel.
And I was like, "I fucking told you to keep an eye on him."
And her face was like, "I was just with this guy for 26 hours."
translation.ko: 리사가 표정으로 이렇게 말했죠 '난 카이랑 26시간을 같이 있었는데'

translation.en: "You couldn't do five minutes?"
We were walking into the Roosevelt Hotel, where Marilyn Monroe used to live,
translation.ko: 같이 루스벨트 호텔로 들어갔어요 한때 마릴린 먼로가 살았고

translation.en: where they used to hold the Oscars, and up comes Kai.
translation.ko: 오스카 시상식이 열리기도 했던 그 호텔에 카이가 입장했죠

translation.en: [JR] We got into the room,
and he immediately was overjoyed to see a minibar.
You know, these were not airplane-sized bottles of liquor.
They were enormous bottles of liquor.
Immediately, he cracked open a Jack Daniels and just started gulping it down.
translation.ko: 카이는 잭 다니엘스를 열어서 들이키기 시작했어요

translation.en: Gulp. Gulp. Gulp. Gulp.
We're not talking pouring it into a glass. We're talking, like, lunatic style.
translation.ko: 잔에 따를 것도 없이 술에 환장한 사람처럼 병나발을 불었어요

translation.en: He was out of control.
I've been around a lot of celebrities,
and I've seen some of them act a little crazy.
translation.ko: 개중엔 미친 짓을 하는 사람도 몇 있었지만

translation.en: But nothing like this.
So our next move is, I think we're gonna get something to eat.
translation.ko: 이제 먹을 걸 사러 가기로 했어요

translation.en: He takes his skateboard. We go down to the lobby of this hotel,
translation.ko: 카이가 스케이트보드를 챙겼고 같이 호텔 로비로 내려갔어요

translation.en: and the lobby of this hotel, it's fancy.
There's fancy people here. It's Saturday night on Hollywood Boulevard.
translation.ko: 할리우드 대로의 토요일 밤이라 럭셔리한 사람들이 모여 있었어요

translation.en: And it's, like, cobblestone.
translation.ko: 로비 바닥은 조약돌 같은 게 깔려 있었고요

translation.en: So he takes his skateboard, rides across, and he goes,
translation.ko: 근데 카이가 그 위로 스케이트보드를 타는 거예요

translation.en: all the way across. We get outside.
Three seconds later, the security comes out
translation.ko: 몇 초 후에 경비원이 따라 나오더니 이랬어요

translation.en: and says, "He can't come back in."
translation.ko: '저분은 다시 들어올 수 없습니다 모두 나가주시죠'

translation.en: "You're all out." And I'm thinking,
translation.ko: '저분은 다시 들어올 수 없습니다 모두 나가주시죠' 호텔 앞에서 오줌 싸는 거 봤으면 난리 났겠다 싶었어요

translation.en: "They don't even know about him peeing in front of the building."
translation.ko: 호텔 앞에서 오줌 싸는 거 봤으면 난리 났겠다 싶었어요

translation.en: They meant business. "Sir, you are outta here."
translation.ko: 농담이 아니라 심각했어요 진짜로 나가란 소리였죠

translation.en: And before I know it, we are out on the sidewalk.
translation.ko: 정신 차려 보니 길가에 나와 있더라고요

translation.en: And then he took off running ahead of us and pulled out a huge knife
translation.ko: 카이는 우리를 앞서가면서 커다란 칼을 꺼내 들더니

translation.en: and tried to throw it into the ground.
Okay, like, this is a little scary.
At first, we were intrigued by Kai and finding him and all that stuff,
translation.ko: 처음엔 카이한테 흥미를 느껴서 사방으로 찾아다녔고

translation.en: and… and we were excited about what we were doing.
translation.ko: 카이랑 쇼를 만들게 돼서 기대로 부풀었는데

translation.en: And now we're kinda like, "Are we okay?"
translation.ko: 이젠 이런 생각이 들더군요 과연 잘하는 일일까?

translation.en: [JR] If what they were after, my production company,
was this carefree, happy, home-free hitchhiker,
who's looking out for the underdog, that was not what this guy was projecting.
translation.ko: 약자를 위해 나서는 히치하이커였다면 카이는 그런 사람이 아니었어요

translation.en: They kicked me out for skateboarding in the middle of the thing
translation.ko: 호텔에서 스케이트보드 타고 위스키 마셨다고 쫓겨났어요

translation.en: -and drinking a bottle of JD. -[woman] This was-- When was this?
translation.ko: 호텔에서 스케이트보드 타고 위스키 마셨다고 쫓겨났어요 언제 그랬는데요?

translation.en: And I peed on the Walk of Fame,
and all these publicity agents are like, "No! Stop! Stop! Stop! Stop!"
I was like… [imitates peeing sound]
I'm kickin' it legit.
[JR] I was texting, "You are not gonna wanna do a reality show with this guy,"
translation.ko: 카이랑 리얼리티쇼를 찍는 건 관두자고 회사에 문자를 보냈어요

translation.en: but I guess from their perspective,
translation.ko: 하지만 윗선의 의견은 이랬던 거 같아요

translation.en: it was more just like, "How bad can this guy really be?"
translation.ko: 하지만 윗선의 의견은 이랬던 거 같아요 '나빠 봤자 얼마나 나쁘겠냐'

translation.en: "Just get him down here."
"We can talk to him ourselves and form our own opinion."
I don't know why I took it upon myself to think,
translation.ko: 왜 그게 내 일이라고 생각했는진 모르겠지만

translation.en: "I'm responsible for him. I'm his babysitter,
translation.ko: 난 카이의 베이비시터니까 걔를 챙겨야 하고

translation.en: and I need to make sure that he gets on The Kimmel Show."
Shouldn't it just be his responsibility or Brad's responsibility?
But all of a sudden, I'm, like, huh,
I don't know if it's a wild or stupid idea.
I had him stay at my house.
It's just the two of us.
He was polite.
Played the guitar.
[Lisa] But there was something kinda dangerous about him, now we're starting to think.
translation.ko: 이제야 드는 생각인데 약간 위험한 분위기가 있긴 했어요

translation.en: Monday, I'm done. Brad can have him, do what he wants with him.
translation.ko: 월요일엔 진이 다 빠졌어요 브래드한테 카이를 알아서 하랬죠

translation.en: I'm not even thinking about our TV show, if we're gonna do anything with it or not.
translation.ko: 우리 프로그램은 생각도 안 났어요 될 대로 돼라 심정이었죠

translation.en: He didn't seem particularly, uh, excited that he was gonna be on The Kimmel Show.
translation.ko: 카이는 '키멀 쇼'에 출연하는데도 딱히 신나는 눈치가 아니었어요

translation.en: At least he was not letting on that he was overly excited about it.
translation.ko: 속으론 기분 째졌는지 몰라도 일단 티는 안 냈죠

translation.en: Lisa and her production team take Kai to the studio.
translation.ko: 리사랑 그 회사 제작진이 카이를 스튜디오로 데려왔어요

translation.en: They pull up and in the back parking lot,
there's this really big Jimmy Kimmel Live! sign
stretched across this chain-link fence. They get out of the car.
translation.ko: 철조망 담장에 길게 걸려 있었죠 사람들이 차에서 내렸고

translation.en: First thing Kai does, walks up to the sign and pisses on the sign.
translation.ko: 카이는 도착하자마자 그 간판으로 가서 거기다 오줌을 쌌어요

translation.en: 'Course, everyone's like, "What the fuck are you…" [laughs]
translation.ko: 다들 벙쪘죠 '이런 미친… 뭐 하는 짓이야?'

translation.en: "What are you doing?" Security guard comes over.
translation.ko: '이런 미친… 뭐 하는 짓이야?' 경비원이 왔어요

translation.en: "What are you doing, bro? You can't do that,"
all this stuff that, yes, of course, you can't do that, Kai.
translation.ko: 뭐 그런 멘트를 했죠 카이, 제발 그러지 말라고

translation.en: You can't do that. They get him, you know, wrangle him, stop him.
translation.ko: 뭐 그런 멘트를 했죠 카이, 제발 그러지 말라고 서로 옥신각신하며 카이를 말렸어요

translation.en: He goes inside. Uh, Jimmy's waiting there.
They take their pictures, do whatever they gotta do,
translation.ko: 사진 찍고 이런저런 걸 한 다음

translation.en: and then Jimmy hands Kai an envelope.
Inside, there was, like, $500 in it.
Kai takes it and gives it to the security guard
and says, "I'm sorry for pissing on the sign."
I remember just thinking, "There's no way in hell
he's actually gonna be on The Jimmy Kimmel Show."
They're gonna see that he's crazy. They're gonna see that he's unstable.
They're gonna see that he's bad news, and the idea's gonna be jettisoned,
translation.ko: 사고뭉치인 걸 알게 될 테고 카이에 대한 기획은 폐기 처분돼서

translation.en: and there's no way he's actually gonna be on the show.
translation.ko: 절대로 출연할 일이 없을 거라고 예상했어요

translation.en: So we're in the green room,
and we're 90 minutes away from the show,
and the police show up.
Hello. There's no picture-taking in here, okay?
Thank you very much. All right, unless you wanna go…
translation.ko: "카이, 토크쇼 출연 직전 구금" 협조 감사합니다, 계속 찍으면…

translation.en: All right, now go on your way. Thanks a lot.
No question, when the police walked in, I knew who they were there for.
translation.ko: 뻔했어요, 경찰을 보고 왜 왔는지 바로 알았죠

translation.en: And they came, and they grabbed him, and they took him.
And I… I've never been more crestfallen.
My name is Jeff Stricker, and in February 2013,
I was a homicide detective with the Fresno County Sheriff's Office.
translation.ko: 프레즈노 카운티 보안관서 소속 살인 사건 담당 형사였죠

translation.en: Jett McBride, who was the driver of the vehicle
translation.ko: 가스 공사 작업자인 레이숀 닐리를 친 운전자

translation.en: that smashed into Rayshawn Neely, the PG&E worker, was in custody,
and Kai was our key witness.
The district attorney investigators didn't know where Kai was,
translation.ko: 검찰 수사관들은 카이의 소재를 모르고 있었는데

translation.en: but social media being what it is these days,
translation.ko: 다들 소셜 미디어를 하는 시대라 그 덕을 봤죠

translation.en: Jimmy Kimmel tweeted,
"Kai the Hatchet-Wielding Hitchhiker will be on the show."
translation.ko: 손도끼를 휘두른 히치하이커 카이가 출연한다고 남겼거든요

translation.en: So they left Fresno and headed on over to LA to meet with Kai.
translation.ko: 수사관들이 그걸 보고 프레즈노에서 LA까지 카이를 데리러 갔어요

translation.en: Some people weren't disappointed that the police came and got him.
translation.ko: 경찰이 카이를 데려갔다고 해서 모두가 김샌 건 아니었어요

translation.en: Some people were like, "Well, that figures," and--
But not me. Not me.
I was wrong about this the whole time. I was like, "We gotta get him back."
translation.ko: 그때까지도 뭘 모르고서 카이를 데려와야 한다고 했어요

translation.en: [reporter] The Fresno County District Attorney's Office enlisted
the help of the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department
to track Kai down at the Jimmy Kimmel studio
translation.ko: 지미 키멀 스튜디오에 있는 카이의 신병을 확보해

translation.en: and take him into custody.
The DA's office served him with a subpoena
and says it needed to get a statement about the attempted murder hate crime
translation.ko: 카이를 유명하게 만든 증오 범죄로 인한 살인 미수 건에

translation.en: that started this whole thing because he is the key witness.
translation.ko: 카이가 주요 목격자로서 진술해야 한다는 내용이었습니다

translation.en: We're all sweating bullets, you know, probably especially Brad.
Kai's social media is blowing up at this point.
translation.ko: 카이의 소셜 미디어에는 댓글이 폭주하고 있었고요

translation.en: I can't even tell you how many hits he's getting.
It's, like, millions.
[Brad] Eventually, about 30 minutes before the show,
the police brought him back. But here's the thing.
translation.ko: 경찰이 카이를 데려왔어요 근데 문제가 있었죠

translation.en: Everything I do, the lead-up, the build-up,
the calling, getting people to agree,
the only thing I don't have control of is what everybody sees.
translation.ko: 이 모든 과정에서 내가 유일하게 통제 못 하는 게 사람들이 방송에서 보게 되는 것들이에요

translation.en: What's on the air. That's the only part I have no control of, what gets on TV.
translation.ko: 사람들이 방송에서 보게 되는 것들이에요 방송 장면만큼은 나도 어쩔 수 없는 부분인데

translation.en: And that's only what everybody remembers.
Jessob's in the front row.
I'm pacing in the green room.
We both know, more than other people know,
translation.ko: 제섭과 난 누구보다도 잘 알고 있었죠

translation.en: how sideways this can go.
I'm about to pick up a very special hitchhiker.
translation.ko: 오늘은 아주 특별한 히치하이커를 태울 건데요

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, please say hi to Kai.
Kai, jump in the car.
Kai! Not on the car, in the car.
I don't know if the car can hold your weight. All right, there we go.
translation.ko: 차가 당신 체중을 못 버틸지도 몰라요 좋아요, 어서 와요

translation.en: -[Kai] Keep your eye on the road, man. -[laughing]
Holy [bleep].
Well, welcome, Kai. Welcome. How are you?
translation.ko: 어서 오세요, 카이 그동안 잘 지냈나요?

translation.en: -Excellent. How about yourself? -I'm doing good.
I had very little confidence it would go well for him.
But, man, I was rooting for him. I was rooting for him.
They described you in the video as "homeless hitchhiker,"
translation.ko: 동영상 보니 사람들이 당신더러 '집 없는 히치하이커'라던데

translation.en: but you don't like the word "homeless."
-Home-free. -Home-free.
It's the land of the free and the home of the brave.
translation.ko: 미국은 자유의 땅이고 용감한 자들의 집이잖아요

translation.en: You don't want to have a home, correct?
What the hell are you talking about? I am home.
-[laughs] Yeah, I see. -[bleep]
So anywhere you are is your home. That's your philosophy.
translation.ko: 어디든 지금 있는 곳이 당신 집이라는 지론이군요

translation.en: Jimmy handled it so well 'cause Kai had, you know,
translation.ko: 지미가 정말 잘 대처했어요 카이는 평소의 카이답게 뜬금없는 질문을 하고

translation.en: in typical Kai fashion, he had some very bizarre answers
translation.ko: 카이는 평소의 카이답게 뜬금없는 질문을 하고

translation.en: and said some very bizarre things, but Jimmy just rolled with it.
translation.ko: 엉뚱한 소리를 했거든요 근데 지미가 자연스럽게 받아넘겼죠

translation.en: A lot of people are calling you a hero because you did.
translation.ko: 사람들이 당신이 한 일을 보고 영웅이라고 하는데요

translation.en: You thwarted that crazy guy, right?
translation.ko: 당신이 그 미친 인간의 폭력을 막았잖아요

translation.en: There's not so much difference between him and who they sell as Jesus anyways.
translation.ko: 그놈이나 예수 파는 다른 놈들이나 다 같은 족속이에요

translation.en: Well, I don't know. I haven't met him.
Did he have a beard?
-No. -[laughs]
No, no, he was… he was a fat, rich, white guy.
translation.ko: 수염 없고 뚱뚱하고 돈 많은 백인 아저씨였죠

translation.en: Now, um, you, uh… Obviously, millions of people have seen--
Nothing against fat, rich people.
translation.ko: 뚱뚱하고 돈 많은 사람들한테 유감은 없어요

translation.en: No, fat, white people, yeah.
Yeah, you're sitting next to one. Um…
translation.ko: 물론이죠, 지금 당신 옆에도 한 명 있잖아요

translation.en: It's great by Jimmy. I've seen him do this hundreds, hundreds of times,
translation.ko: 지미가 분위기를 살렸죠 지미가 이러는 걸 한두 번 본 게 아니지만요

translation.en: where the… That is an example of Kai trying to be funny,
and Jimmy knowing how to stop it,
say something self-deprecating and move on to the next point.
translation.ko: 자기 비하적인 농담을 하며 다음으로 넘어간 거예요

translation.en: God, he's good.
Let's step outside the car for one second,
because I don't know if you're gonna give this away immediately,
translation.ko: 이걸 여기서 바로 줘도 되는지 모르겠지만

translation.en: but we have something for you.
There you go. A Mini Mal surfboard and a wetsuit.
Do with it as you will. If you choose to give it away, then so be it.
translation.ko: 마음대로 해요 다른 사람 주고 싶으면 그래도 돼요

translation.en: [laughing] I can't tell you how many people got a hold of me
trying to get him a surfboard and a wetsuit
translation.ko: 카이한테 서프보드랑 웨트슈트부터 원하는 걸 다 주고 싶댔죠

translation.en: and all those things he wanted. Just from that line,
translation.ko: 카이한테 서프보드랑 웨트슈트부터 원하는 걸 다 주고 싶댔죠 그 말 한마디에 선물 제의가 쇄도했는데

translation.en: he had hundreds and hundreds of offers. Shit, Jimmy Kimmel gave it to him.

translation.en: the talk shows.
I didn't care. I just wanted to make sure that he was back

Hey, peeps, how's it going?

[reporter] Tanya Baker testified that McBride attacked her

Was this him being the hero or not?

Kai said he did, and in my interview with Jett,

translation.en: And he's still holding onto her hair. I was like [bleep].

translation.en: [Brad] Hitting someone in the head with a hatchet three times,

And yet because of his demeanor,

And all I saw was the kind Kai.
The violent Kai, who showed himself to me right there,

translation.en: I didn't see it.
In the original interview, when I first talked to him,

You see all these teeth marks right here, for the camera?

translation.ko: 폭행을 막았으면 됐지 그 남자를 굳이 팼어야 할까요?

But then I saw a video of him playing the acoustic guitar…

translation.en: and I thought, "It's not bad."
♪ I've never seen A beauty like you before ♪
♪ Breathless kisses through the door… ♪

translation.en: He has a nice voice and just sounds like a campfire guy with an acoustic guitar.
translation.ko: 목소리도 좋고 캠프 가면 꼭 모닥불 앞에서 기타 치는 그런 캐릭터가 떠올랐죠

translation.en: We said yes because we wanted Kai's crowd. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 하겠다고 했어요 카이를 보러 올 팬들을 노렸거든요

and then we wanted to kill it and win them over.
translation.ko: 끝내주는 무대를 보여줘서 우리 팬으로 만들 작정이었죠

"You made 20 fans tonight." "You made 50 fans."
[man] Kai came in to Fresno like a big ball of fire.

translation.en: He comes in for soundcheck,
and I feel I'm a good judge of character. I just was put off by him pretty quickly

translation.en: just the way he talked, interacted, and treated my staff.
translation.ko: 말투나 행동거지나 우리 직원들 대하는 태도 다요

translation.en: He'd walk up to the bar almost demanding, like, a free beer
translation.ko: 바 쪽으로 갔는데 공짜 맥주를 바라는 눈치였죠

translation.en: because of who he was, and it's like, "Yeah, you know, we don't do that here."
translation.ko: 유명인이니까 당연하다는 식으로요 우린 그런 거 없다고 했더니

translation.en: But then he would go out and get somebody to buy his drinks for him.
translation.ko: 나가서 맥주 사줄 사람을 구해 오더라고요

translation.en: [Gabriel] We do soundcheck, and he was talking about that day,

translation.en: the day that he hit the man on the head with a hatchet.
And in Kai's words, he's bragging,

translation.ko: '사실 다른 약도 섞여 있었어 그 자식 상상도 못 했을걸'

translation.en: He starts listing drugs. I don't know what they are.
translation.ko: 카이가 거기 들어간 약을 읊는데 듣도 보도 못한 것들이었어요

translation.en: But what Kai explicitly told me was that he handed this man a laced joint,
translation.ko: 카이가 대놓고 말했어요 자기가 그 운전자한테 다른 약이 섞인 대마초를 줬다고요

translation.en: and then Kai proceeds to tell me,
"Then he starts flipping out over nothing 'cause he can't handle his shit,"
translation.ko: '그놈이 급흥분하더라고 약이 너무 세서 감당 안 된 거지'

translation.en: and he's laughing.
And I'm horrified, and he's telling a group of people,
translation.ko: 난 등골이 오싹했죠 다른 사람들도 같이 들었는데 다 웃더라고요

translation.en: and they're all laughing. No one's listening to what he's saying,
translation.ko: 다른 사람들도 같이 들었는데 다 웃더라고요 아무도 카이 말을 진지하게 듣질 않았어요

translation.en: and I'm standing there, and I'm thinking, "Oh my God."
"Kai just confessed something huge."
"He drugged this guy?"
That's like starting a fire,
and then putting the fire out and being called a hero.
translation.ko: 불을 껐다는 이유로 영웅 대접을 받은 거잖아요

translation.en: So I understand that the police have tested the marijuana
and they did toxicology on the driver.
But, honestly, if you think about this,
what if there's something that just didn't show up on the test?
translation.ko: 검사에 안 걸린 약도 있을 수 있잖아요

translation.en: And then he was talking about life and having a positive attitude.
translation.ko: 그러다 카이는 인생에 대해 말하며 긍정적인 태도가 중요하다고 했어요

translation.en: "You just gotta go through, man," and it's very hippie,
translation.ko: 흔들리지 말고 살라는데 완전 히피 분위기였죠

translation.en: and then, out of nowhere, he said,
"Unless some old man fucks you in the ass,
and you have to keep it real and take him out."
And it was so bizarre.
And then he, like a switch, went back to,
"Everything's fine," and everybody kinda just accepted that.
translation.ko: 아무 일 없던 것처럼요 다들 그런 분위기로 넘어갔고요

translation.en: And that was another one of those things where I thought, "What just happened?"
translation.ko: 그걸 보면서 난 또 어이가 없었죠 '이거 무슨 분위기지?'

translation.en: And I went inside, and I was kind of shaken
and going, "I have to play this show now with this knowledge,"
translation.ko: '이런 엄청난 얘기를 듣고 공연을 해야 한단 말이지?'

translation.en: and our drummer's mom, who's a photographer,
translation.ko: 사진작가였던 우리 드러머의 엄마가 날 불렀어요

translation.en: says, "Gabe, get next to Kai. Come take a picture."
And I thought, "Oh my God."
"I don't wanna be seen with this man when all of this comes out,"
translation.ko: '이 모든 게 밝혀진 다음에 같이 찍은 사진이 돌면 어쩌라고'

translation.en: 'cause I was thinking, "This is gonna come out."
"This is gonna be huge."
And it never did.
[Gabriel] I honestly don't even remember staying for Kai's show.
translation.ko: 남아서 카이 공연을 본 기억은 없어요

translation.en: I was kinda shaken up that night by how he behaved.
♪ If you wake up dead Bullets in your head ♪
translation.ko: 일어났더니 죽어 있고 머리에 총알이 있다면

translation.en: ♪ I'm killing you, one by fucking one ♪
translation.ko: 내가 널 죽일 거야 하나씩, 하나씩

translation.en: ♪ Not regretting a thing Of what I've done ♪
translation.ko: 내가 한 일은 하나도 후회 안 해

translation.en: [Tony] I ended up kicking him out after his performance
for urinating on one of our bushes.
It's like, "Yeah, you don't come and disrespect our place like this."
translation.ko: 우리 클럽을 이따위로 모욕하지 말라고 해줬죠

translation.en: He burned bridges.
translation.ko: 카이는 돌이킬 수 없는 실수를 했어요

translation.en: It's a big city, but it has a small-town feel.
translation.ko: 프레즈노는 큰 도시면서도 작은 동네의 분위기가 있죠

translation.en: If you get burned in this town, word spreads.
translation.ko: 이 동네에서 사고 치면 금방 소문이 돌아요

translation.en: My last words were, "Get the fuck outta here."
When I look at Kai, I don't know what his headspace is.
translation.ko: 카이를 보면 어떤 정신 상태인지를 모르겠어요

translation.en: I don't know how healthy his headspace is.
But I think that living carefree and lawlessly for so long,
translation.ko: 그렇게 오랫동안 속 편하게 무법 상태로 살다 보면

translation.en: he didn't have a sense of consequences.
People gave him a lot of opportunity,
and I think he got in that mindset, like,
translation.ko: 그러다 보니 이런 마인드가 생겼던 거 같아요

translation.en: "This is Kai's world now," you know?
Because there was a lot of people filling his head
with things he can do and get away with, and maybe that backfired a little bit.
translation.ko: 내키는 대로 해도 괜찮다는 생각을 심어줬죠 그게 역효과를 낸 것 같아요

translation.en: [man] So I'm sure you know who Kai the Hatchet-Wielding Hitchhiker is by now.
translation.ko: 다들 손도끼를 휘두른 히치하이커 카이를 알고 있겠지?

translation.en: He is all over YouTube.
He's everybody's favorite hero right now, but, uh, I actually met him.
translation.ko: 모두의 최애 영웅이 된 카이를 내가 직접 만났어

translation.en: Are you his agent?
Am I his agent? No, I don't have, nor am I had by anybody.
translation.ko: 내가? 난 매니저 같은 거 없고 남의 매니저도 아니야

translation.en: But no matter what you've done, you deserve respect.
translation.ko: 여태 어떻게 살았든 너희는 존중받을 자격이 있어

translation.en: No matter your looks or your skills, you're worthwhile.
translation.ko: 외모, 능력에 상관없이 여러분은 가치 있는 존재야

translation.en: No, this is for everyone.
And it doesn't matter, like, if you make mistakes,
translation.ko: 상관없어, 실수해도 여전히 사랑받을 수 있어

translation.en: you're still lovable. There's four different types of love.
translation.ko: 상관없어, 실수해도 여전히 사랑받을 수 있어 사랑엔 네 종류가 있어

translation.en: There's putting up with somebody. There's liking somebody.
translation.ko: 누군가를 견디는 사랑 누군가를 좋아하는 사랑

translation.en: There's, then, like, romantically liking somebody,
and there's, like, actually be willing to kill somebody else for somebody.
translation.ko: 마지막으로 누군가를 위해 다른 사람을 죽일 수도 있는 사랑

translation.en: Like, sacrificial love.
[Jessob] The Kimmel Show was 100% the peak.
The viral fame started, and it just snowballed and snowballed,
so the fame was growing. It was more fun.
More things were happening for Kai, and things were getting more amazing.
translation.ko: 카이에겐 신나는 일이 늘어만 갔어요 갈수록 잘 나가다가 갑자기

translation.en: Then all of a sudden, Jimmy Kimmel's here, 'cause it was the best, and then…
translation.ko: 갈수록 잘 나가다가 갑자기 최고조였던 '지미 키멀 쇼'가 여기라면 이렇게 되면서…

translation.en: slowly just came down and…
[Brad] For most people, what they know of him is something maybe we wanna be.
translation.ko: 사람들이 카이에게서 보는 건 어쩌면 우리의 희망 사항일지도 몰라요

translation.en: Maybe many of us don't want the responsibilities we have,
translation.ko: 우리에게 주어진 책임이 부담스러워서일 수도 있죠

translation.en: the bills and the cars and the insurance and the property taxes,
translation.ko: 공과금, 자동차 할부, 보험 재산세 등등요

translation.en: and this guy was living that life without those responsibilities,
translation.ko: 근데 카이는 그런 책임 없는 인생을 살고 있었고

translation.en: and it was going well.
And then… then it didn't.
It's a much more sad existence
than maybe the exhilarating or free experience people think.
translation.ko: 신나고 자유로운 경험보다는 훨씬 슬픈 삶입니다

translation.en: Friday, May 10th, 2013,
a little over three months after, uh, the incident
that started this whole incredible journey,
translation.ko: 그 사건이 일어나고 3개월이 갓 지난 후에

translation.en: he shows up in New York City

translation.ko: 그리고 페이스북에 이런 불편하고 불길한 글을 올리죠

translation.en: He talked about this being his Mother's Day message,

It reads,
"First memories I was in a crib and 'family' was fussin over me."
translation.ko: '아기 침대에 있을 때의 첫 기억은' '가족들이 날 보고 호들갑을 떠는 거였다'

translation.en: "But I kept getting told that 'I had a demon.'"
"I would get locked in a room for 20 hours a day
with a little porta potty camp toilet in the corner of the room."
"Then after that my mouth filled with hot pepper and soap
translation.ko: '그러다 내 입에다 매운 고추랑 비누를 처넣었다'

translation.en: for yelling fuck you at the top of my lungs."
Signing off, "happy Mother's Day."
And, of course, you know, I remember when I met him
for the first time after the original incident in Stockton,

he definitely disclosed
some really, really terrible things that happened to him.
And, you know, obviously in the medium I was working in, local news,
translation.ko: 제가 일하던 매체는 지역 뉴스 방송국이다 보니

translation.en: you can't put a lot of that stuff on TV.
translation.ko: 그런 얘기는 대부분 방송에 내보낼 수가 없었죠

translation.en: I just turned 17 on the road.
translation.ko: 집을 떠난 채로 막 17살이 된 때였는데

translation.en: There was this guy, and he held me down,
and then he, like, hit me a couple times, and he started choking me.
Uh, he turned me over and he pulled my pants down and started raping me.
translation.ko: 그러다 내 몸을 뒤집어서 바지를 벗기고 날 강간하기 시작했어요

translation.en: As this was happening and Kai was laying on the ground,
translation.ko: 이 일이 벌어지는 동안 카이는 바닥에 누워있었고

translation.en: that's when he said, you know, he looked up to the sky
and, uh, saw this crow fly over in that moment
translation.ko: 카이 말로는 그때 하늘을 쳐다봤더니 그 순간 까마귀 한 마리가 날아가다 카이한테 이랬대요

translation.en: and told him, "Get up, fight for yourself, and run."
translation.ko: 그 순간 까마귀 한 마리가 날아가다 카이한테 이랬대요 '일어나서 맞서 싸워 그리고 도망쳐'

translation.en: And that's what he did, and he got away from the guy.
translation.ko: 카이는 그 말대로 해서 사내한테서 도망쳤고요

translation.en: Um, and, you know, I don't know if he saw that guy again
or if that guy ever got in trouble for it,
but, um, you know, a lot of it seems hard to believe,
but, you know, I'm in no place to tell him it didn't happen.
translation.ko: 그렇다고 내가 사실이 아니라고 판단할 입장도 아니죠

translation.en: So all I'm left to believe is that it happened.
translation.ko: 결국 실제 있었던 일이라고 믿을 수밖에요

translation.en: Tell me more.
Oh, bro. Okay, you want me to start from when I was a kid?
I was locked in a cage for fucking four years and treated like an animal.
Uh, they installed a lock on the door that went from the outside in
translation.ko: 내 방문에다 바깥에서 잠그는 자물쇠를 달아놓고

translation.en: so that they could sit and watch TV and fuck and shit.
translation.ko: 자기들끼리 TV 보고 할 거 다 했죠

translation.en: You get kinda jaded with interviews,
and you kinda have, like, a truth meter on if what they're saying is accurate,
translation.ko: 사람들이 사실을 말하는지 알 수 있는 진실 계량기 비슷한 감이 생기는데요

translation.en: and I didn't know if it was 100% true.
But even if, like, 50% of what he was saying was true,

translation.ko: 너무나 끔찍한 어린 시절을 보낸 거죠

translation.en: My name's Jeremy McGillivary Wolfe, and I'm Kai's first cousin.
translation.ko: 난 제러미 맥길버리 울프예요 카이의 사촌이죠

translation.en: He was my brother, basically.
Seeing him on Kimmel and that, just wow. This guy's going viral big-time,
translation.ko: '키멀 쇼'에 나온 거 보고 깜짝 놀랐죠 엄청나게 떴구나 싶더라고요

translation.en: and I was in shock, like, the whole time.
I'm still in shock to this day, to tell you the truth.
translation.ko: 솔직히 말하면 아직도 충격에서 못 벗어났어요

translation.en: This was someone I grew up with giving this outrageous interview.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 같이 자란 사람이 저런 엄청난 인터뷰를 한다니 말이에요

translation.en: But I never knew him as Kai, not once. I just knew him as Caleb.
translation.ko: 하지만 카이라고 부른 적은 없어요 단 한 번도요 나한테는 늘 케일럽이었죠

translation.en: I heard Kai for the first time during the YouTube video.
translation.ko: 카이란 이름은 유튜브 영상에서 처음 들었어요

translation.en: I don't have any family.
Like, as far as anybody I grew up with is concerned, I'm already dead.
translation.ko: 내가 같이 자란 사람들한테 난 이미 죽은 사람이죠

translation.en: So, whatever.
I felt bad after he said that, and, like, we care about you, you know?
translation.ko: 그 말을 듣고 마음이 안 좋았어요 우린 아직도 그 애를 아끼니까요

translation.en: You shouldn't feel that way. We always did.
translation.ko: 그런 생각 안 하면 좋겠어요 한 번도 그 애를 잊은 적 없어요
