translation.ko: 아무리 싸웠대도 사랑하지 않는 건 아니에요

translation.en: Caleb's parents had split up when he was four.
Growing up, he was loud. He was funny and mischievous.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 케일럽은 시끄럽고 재밌는 말썽꾸러기였죠

translation.en: Very mischievous.
I was able to act like a boy,
translation.ko: 난 평범한 남자애답게 행동할 수가 있었어요

translation.en: and I was able to go outside and play.
Caleb wasn't given that privilege.
He was kept at home.
His mom locked him in a room for quite some time,
translation.ko: 케일럽의 엄마가 한동안 방에 가둬 놓았었죠

translation.en: and when… She tried to lock me in a room as well.
translation.ko: 나까지 방에 가두려고 한 적도 있고요

translation.en: We had just finished supper. It was summertime,
translation.ko: 막 저녁을 먹은 다음이었는데 여름이라 창문이 열려 있어서

translation.en: and the window was open,
so you could hear kids still playing outside.
But there was dark blankets on the window,
translation.ko: 근데 창문에 검은 담요가 걸려 있었죠

translation.en: so it was completely blacked out to make it look like it was night.
translation.ko: 빛이 전혀 들어오질 않아서 꼭 한밤중 같았어요

translation.en: So we knew he had it difficult.
This one time, he tried to start a fire in his house,
translation.ko: 한번은 케일럽이 집에다 불을 지르려고 했어요

translation.en: and then, not long after, his mom decided that she couldn't cope with him anymore.
translation.ko: 그 얼마 후에 케일럽의 엄마는 더 이상 그 애를 감당 못 하겠다고 했죠

translation.en: He was 13 when he went to Bosco Homes,
translation.ko: 케일럽은 13살 때 보스코 홈스란 곳으로 가게 됐어요

translation.en: which is a place where they take troubled teens, I guess,
that, um, got in trouble in their youth and had no home
or just come from families that didn't want them, I guess.
Um, if you're still watching this,
that means that you obviously like what you see,
translation.ko: 방금 본 게 마음에 들었단 뜻이겠지?

translation.en: so that's very nice and very pretty.
You may notice that my eyes seem very dark.
In fact, maybe the whole picture seems dark right now.
Something I think Madame Guyon called "the dark night of the soul."
translation.ko: 마담 귀용이 말한 '영혼의 암흑 같은 밤'인가 봐

translation.en: [Jeremy] The littlest thing would trigger him.
Caleb didn't realize whether you were laughing with him
translation.ko: 자기랑 같이 웃는 건지 자기를 비웃는 건지

translation.en: or you were laughing at him,
and he would get so angry if he thought you were teasing him or making fun of him.
He would go into these little rages, and then snap outta them.
♪ When I was four ♪
♪ I had a lighter ♪
♪ Tried to burn my parent's house Right to the ground… ♪
translation.ko: 부모님 집을 태워서 잿더미로 만들려고 했지

translation.en: I honestly believe Caleb has, like, mental… mental issues
because he seems well,
but when it comes to a certain situation of pressure,
you either become a diamond or you get crushed.
And in this case, Caleb gets crushed.
♪ I mean, it's like ♪
♪ We all wild and feral inside ♪
♪ Ain't nothin' That you gotta try and hide ♪
I'm Shirley. I'm Caleb's mother.
He's also known as Kai, and I go by the given name
translation.ko: 카이로 더 유명하지만 본명인 케일럽으로 부를게요

translation.en: because of what it means. Bold and courageous.
I didn't ever lock him in a room.
Like, "lock him in a room."
Um, I had to put, uh, for a short period of time,
uh, the ability… stop the ability of him getting out of the room too early
translation.ko: 그 애가 방에서 너무 일찍 못 나오게 한 적은 있죠

translation.en: because he was a free spirit
and would get up earlier than I did and get into stuff that could harm him
translation.ko: 나보다 빨리 일어나서 위험한 장난을 했거든요

translation.en: and, being a responsible parent, needed to not allow that to happen.
translation.ko: 책임감 있는 부모로서 사고를 막으려고 했던 거예요

translation.en: And it was for a short period of time.
For his best interest and the, you know, safety, you know, of a little guy.
translation.ko: 그 애를 위해 그랬던 거죠 아들의 안전을 위해서요

translation.en: Not really understanding what's going on,
the medical field wondered if he, you know, had ADHD and things like that.
But kind of in the end,
there wasn't actually one diagnosis that was anything.
It was kind of their grasp at, "How do we… How do we help?"
translation.ko: 병원에서도 그 애를 파악해 보려던 거겠죠 그 애를 도와주고

translation.en: "How do we do this? How do we navigate this?"
translation.ko: 상황에 대처하고 해결할 방법을 찾기 위해서요

translation.en: And… And time…
Time did it.
Smash! Smash!
-Smash! -Is that really you?
-Oh yeah. -Dude, come here, please. Please.
translation.ko: - 본인 맞아요? - 그럼요 잠깐 이리 와봐요

translation.en: Hey, smash!
Can you buy me a bottle if you can take 17 pictures of me?
translation.ko: 사진 17장 찍어 줄 테니 술 한 병 살래요?

translation.en: -This is a video. We'll give you a beer. -Smash guy!
-Smash! -Smash!
-Smash! -Oh shit!
Smash! Smash!
-Smash! -Fucking hero right here.
-Smash! -[man] Oh!
I didn't realize he had become very famous,
and there's real, genuine people out there who wanted to reach out
translation.ko: 정말 진심인 사람들이 그 애한테 다가가서

translation.en: and say, "Way to go, buddy," and, "Hey, we're here for you."
And I don't think that part was necessarily bad.
Loves people. Very much an outgoing person.
translation.ko: 케일럽은 사람을 좋아하고 아주 외향적인 아이거든요

translation.en: But I was a bit concerned because he's a very trusting person,
translation.ko: 하지만 워낙 사람을 잘 믿는 애라 걱정이 됐어요

translation.en: and I know that not everybody should be trusted.
"Are you the real Kai? Are you the real Kai? Is that really you?"
"Did that really happen?"
And it's, like, if you was a lot bigger than you are,
I'd just reach out, and I'd be like, "Smack!"
"Does that feel real?"
Caleb is a person who's always led with his heart.
translation.ko: 케일럽은 마음 가는 대로 행동하는 타입이에요

translation.en: And because of that, he's very trusting.
I'm not sure that's always healthy for people,
translation.ko: 그게 늘 사람한테 도움이 되는 건 아니에요

translation.en: and I certainly see in the situation with my son
where I'm not sure it was the best, um,
in that it… I think it put him in a situation that possibly set him up.
translation.ko: 그런 성격 때문에 케일럽이 함정에 빠졌다고 봅니다

translation.en: [woman] What do you mean?
As in that he was trusting the wrong people.
translation.ko: 믿어서는 안 될 사람을 믿은 거죠

translation.en: [reporter] Concerns this morning in a New Jersey neighborhood
translation.ko: 오늘 아침 뉴저지 주택가에서 사건이 발생했습니다 "인터넷 바이럴이 되고 3개월 후"

translation.en: as police try to solve the killing of a well-known attorney.
translation.ko: "인터넷 바이럴이 되고 3개월 후" 경찰이 저명한 변호사의 살인 사건을 수사 중인데요

translation.en: The 73-year-old victim was discovered inside his home
translation.ko: 73세의 피해자는 클라크 스타라이트 드라이브의 자택에서 숨진 채 발견됐습니다

translation.en: on Starlite Drive in Clark.
translation.ko: 클라크 스타라이트 드라이브의 자택에서 숨진 채 발견됐습니다

translation.en: That's where Joseph Galfy lived for the past 15 years.
Friends knew something was wrong when Galfy didn't show up for work Monday.
translation.ko: 피해자가 월요일에 결근하자 이를 이상하게 여긴 친구들이 911에 신고했고

translation.en: They called 911, and police found him inside his home beaten to death.
translation.ko: 이를 이상하게 여긴 친구들이 911에 신고했고 경찰은 자택에서 폭행으로 숨진 피해자를 발견했습니다

translation.en: I'm Bob Ellenport, friend of Joe Galfy, my backyard neighbor.
translation.ko: 난 조 갈피의 친구이자 이웃인 밥 엘런포트입니다

translation.en: I received a phone call from Joe Galfy's secretary,
and it said that Joe was scheduled to be in court, and he didn't show up,
translation.ko: 조가 법정에 오기로 돼 있는데 안 왔다는 거예요

translation.en: and she couldn't reach him on his, uh, cell phone.
Could I check and see if anyone was home?
And so I walked over
and saw that the Sunday newspaper and the Monday newspaper were still on Joe's front stoop.
translation.ko: 일요일 신문, 월요일 신문이 현관 계단에 그대로 있었어요

translation.en: [man] Joseph Galfy's New York Times was still on the front porch.
translation.ko: 조지프 갈피가 보는 뉴욕 타임스가 그대로 현관에 있었어요

translation.en: That was kind of odd because he was a guy who stuck to his schedule.
translation.ko: 이상한 일이었죠 갈피는 일정을 지키는 사람이고 매일 아침 신문을 챙겼거든요

translation.en: He was, uh, somebody who picked up his paper every morning.
translation.ko: 갈피는 일정을 지키는 사람이고 매일 아침 신문을 챙겼거든요

translation.en: So the fact that it was there was concerning enough
translation.ko: "존 홀 유니언 카운티 검찰청 홍보 이사" 신문이 그대로 있다는 것만으로

translation.en: to call the police to do a welfare check.
translation.ko: 경찰이 신변 안전을 확인할 사유가 됐어요

translation.en: [man] The home itself, everything looked in place,
nothing ransacked.
But as they go room to room and eventually get to the master bedroom
translation.ko: 하지만 경찰이 차례로 방을 수색하다 결국 안방에서 조 갈피의 시신을 발견했습니다

translation.en: is where they discover Joe Galfy's lifeless body.
translation.ko: 결국 안방에서 조 갈피의 시신을 발견했습니다 "딘 마캔토니오" "유니언 카운티 검찰청 살인 사건 전담팀"

translation.en: He's on the floor, you know, just clothed in underwear and socks,
translation.ko: 시신은 바닥에 있었고 속옷과 양말을 신은 상태였으며 주변에는 피가 흥건했죠

translation.en: lying in a pool of blood.
translation.ko: 속옷과 양말을 신은 상태였으며 주변에는 피가 흥건했죠

translation.en: Once you go into a house, basically any house,
you're looking for signs of a struggle.
Were things out of place? Were drawers ransacked?
translation.ko: 자리에서 벗어난 물건이나 서랍을 뒤진 흔적

translation.en: Things toppled over?
But this house didn't have any of that.
translation.ko: 근데 이 집엔 그런 게 전혀 없었어요

translation.en: This house was very neat, very organized. There was no forced entry.
translation.ko: 잘 정리돼 있고 깨끗한 상태에 문을 억지로 딴 흔적도 없었죠

translation.en: But then in the family room,
there's a laptop on a stand next to a chair,
translation.ko: 의자 옆 탁자에 놓인 노트북 컴퓨터를 발견했어요

translation.en: and under the computer is a phone number
with the name "Lawrence Kai."
We didn't know who Kai was until we googled him.
translation.ko: 검색해 보고서야 카이가 누군지 알게 됐어요

translation.en: And up popped a video.
And in the video, he had a hatchet,
and he described exactly what he was doing,
and I believe it was, "Bam! Bam! Bam!"
translation.ko: 이런 소리도 냈던 거 같아요 '팡, 팡, 팡!'

translation.en: Made you stop and think.
Could he be responsible for something like this?
So as we're scouring the master bedroom where… where Mr. Galfy's body was found,
translation.ko: 갈피 씨의 시신이 발견된 안방을 수색하는데

translation.en: one of the detectives brought to my attention a train ticket,
and the date of the ticket was the day before.
Sunday. It was Mother's Day, 9:38 a.m.
So we sent people to the train station to see if there's video.
translation.ko: CCTV 영상을 확인하러 역으로 사람을 보냈어요

translation.en: And we're looking to see if we could see the deceased Mr. Galfy.
translation.ko: 영상에서 고인이 된 갈피 씨의 모습을 찾아보았죠

translation.en: [Rob] We don't get video right away oftentimes,
but in this case, we did.
And in the video, you could see Mr. Galfy,
and you can clearly see him purchase a ticket,
translation.ko: 기차표를 사는 장면이 또렷이 찍혀 있었어요

translation.en: and he takes the ticket, and he turns, and he gives it to somebody off-camera.
translation.ko: 갈피 씨는 표를 꺼낸 후 돌아서서 카메라 밖의 누군가에게 건넵니다

translation.en: And you can see it's another male, longish hair,
translation.ko: 이제 또 다른 남성이 보이죠 장발에 곱슬머리고 배낭을 메고 있습니다

translation.en: sorta curly, with a backpack, and they're waiting for the train to come.
translation.ko: 장발에 곱슬머리고 배낭을 메고 있습니다 두 사람은 기차를 기다립니다

translation.en: [Dean] So we have this information on this Internet phenom,
translation.ko: 이렇게 해서 인터넷 스타인 손도끼를 휘두른 히치하이커 카이에 대한 정보를 입수했어요

translation.en: Kai the Hatchet-Wielding Hitchhiker,
translation.ko: 손도끼를 휘두른 히치하이커 카이에 대한 정보를 입수했어요

translation.en: as I think they named him out in California.
translation.ko: 아마도 캘리포니아 쪽에서 붙인 별명 같은데요

translation.en: And we're looking at this video of New Jersey Transit
and saying to ourselves, "Is this possible?"
"Is this the same guy out in California?"
So a call was made to the Fresno, California police department.
I talked to this detective who has a pretty heavy East Coast accent.
He says, "Hey, we're looking for a guy."
"Uh, he might be involved in a murder, but we're not sure at this point."
translation.ko: 확실하진 않지만 살인 사건에 연루됐을 수 있다고 했어요

translation.en: "It's some homeless guy. He was in Fresno a while back,"
and I say, "Kai? Are you looking for Kai?"
And he's like, "Give me all the information you have,"
so I get him everything I have.
And when we gave him the name we had, Lawrence Kai,
translation.ko: 우리 쪽에서 알고 있는 이름 로런스 카이를 말했더니

translation.en: they said, "Oh yeah, we know him as Kai, but his name is Caleb McGillvary."
translation.ko: 그쪽에선 카이로 유명하지만 실명은 케일럽 맥길버리라더군요

translation.en: He kinda puts the phone away, and I can hear him yell to the room, like,
translation.ko: 그쪽에서 수화기를 내려놓고 주변에 이렇게 외치는 게 들렸어요

translation.en: "Hey, we finally found the motherfucker!"
You know, it was an a-ha moment for us. It was, "Bingo. I think we have the guy."
translation.ko: 우리한테는 결정적인 순간이었어요 용의자를 찾았다 싶었죠

translation.en: And we learned from them that this guy's a nomad.
translation.ko: 캘리포니아 쪽에서 말하길 이자는 떠돌이라고 하더군요

translation.en: He lives off the earth.
He lives off the kindness of others.
He's an opportunist.
So the chance of him traveling cross-country
and being in New York is likely.
It gave us further confirmation that this guy, Kai, is our suspect.
translation.ko: 이 카이란 인물이 용의자라는 것을 더욱 확신하게 됐습니다

translation.en: [Rob] So now we had to find Kai
He had a phone, but that was dead.
So then it was out to the public. We released a press statement.
translation.ko: 그래서 공개적으로 수배했어요 보도 자료를 배포했죠

translation.en: Breaking news. Minutes ago, we learned who police are searching for
translation.ko: 속보입니다, 몇 분 전 경찰이 뉴저지주 클라크에서 있었던

translation.en: in the murder of a lawyer in Clark, New Jersey.
Wait until you hear who they are looking for.
Caleb Lawrence McGillvary.
You might also know him as Kai the Hatchet-Wielding Hitchhiker.
translation.ko: 여러분도 익히 알고 계실 인물이죠 바로 손도끼를 휘두른 히치하이커 카이입니다

translation.en: He should be considered armed and dangerous.
They don't know where he is.
He relies on the generosity of strangers for food and lodging.
translation.ko: 타인의 호의에 의존해 먹을 것과 잘 곳을 해결하고 있습니다

translation.en: Remember, he's a hitchhiker. He could be anywhere.
translation.ko: 히치하이커인 만큼 어디든 나타날 수 있습니다

translation.en: Will he try to kill again? Will he kill again?
The thrill of the hunt is on.
[Jessob] I immediately reached out to him.
I wanna talk to him and figure out what the fuck is going on.
translation.ko: 대체 어떻게 된 일인지 듣고 싶었죠

translation.en: When you find out that the authorities are, you know, looking for someone
translation.ko: 나름 정이 들었고 좋은 관계에 있던 사람이

translation.en: that you've kind of grown to care about and you have a nice relationship with,
translation.ko: 경찰의 수배 대상이 된 걸 알게 됐는데

translation.en: now they're looking, you know, at him for murder,
I'm a mental mess.
[Shirley] One of my sons that lived close to me came to the door.
translation.ko: 근처에 사는 아들애 하나가 집에 찾아왔더라고요

translation.en: I said, "How are you doing?" He said, "Mom, have you heard?"
I said, "Have I heard what?"
He said, "Have you heard that Caleb's wanted for murder?"
translation.ko: 근데 케일럽이 살인 용의자로 쫓기고 있대요

translation.en: And I'm like,
"Nope, haven't heard that. Crap, what happened?"
translation.ko: 처음 듣는 소리라고 어떻게 된 거냐고 물었죠

translation.en: My name is Ted Romankow. I'm the Union County prosecutor.
translation.ko: 전 유니언 카운티의 검사인 테드 로맨코입니다

translation.en: Uh, we're here today to announce that an arrest warrant has been issued
translation.ko: 케일럽 맥길버리에 대한 체포 영장이 발부됐음을

translation.en: for the arrest of, uh, Caleb, uh, McGillvary.
We felt he was dangerous. I mean, here's a man who was…
translation.ko: 위험인물이라고 판단했어요 이미 캘리포니아에서 손도끼로 사람을 공격한 전력이 있었죠

translation.en: He attacked someone in California with a hatchet.
translation.ko: 이미 캘리포니아에서 손도끼로 사람을 공격한 전력이 있었죠

translation.en: He didn't know that driver more than a few hours, and he attacked him.
translation.ko: 만난 지 몇 시간밖에 안 된 운전자를 공격했습니다

translation.en: And he was roaming around our area somewhere,
translation.ko: 그런 인물이 우리 주변 지역을 배회하고 있었고

translation.en: and we thought he was an extremely dangerous character,
so we advised the public of that.
We don't know where he is, but we do know
translation.ko: 현재 위치는 알 수 없지만 길거리를 떠도는 데 익숙하다는 사실은 알고 있으며

translation.en: that this man is used to being on the road,
translation.ko: 길거리를 떠도는 데 익숙하다는 사실은 알고 있으며

translation.en: and he is considered dangerous.
Make no mistake about it.
He is considered armed and dangerous.
[Lisa] My first thought is, like,
"Holy fucking shit. Like, this guy stayed at my house."
translation.ko: 젠장, 우리 집에서 재웠던 사람이 살인 용의자라니요

translation.en: "I could've been killed. You know, something could've happened."
translation.ko: 내가 죽었을 수도 있고 무슨 변을 당했을지 모르잖아요

translation.en: I thought, "Are the police even gonna find this guy?"
'Cause he can easily disappear.
I knew that Kai as a witness was hard to track down,
translation.ko: 카이는 목격자일 때도 찾느라고 애를 먹었었죠

translation.en: and I kinda had some sympathy for the detectives with,
"How are they gonna track him down as a suspect?"
translation.ko: 용의자가 됐으니 잡기가 더 힘들 거 아니에요

translation.en: I got flooded with emails, flooded with messages,
because we're always gonna be linked.
And it sucked. I mean, it sucked
because, you know, all I ever wanted was good things for this guy.
Now… he's wanted for possibly killing someone.
It blew my mind. "What do you mean there's a manhunt for Kai?
translation.ko: 카이를 추적 중이란 말을 듣고 어이가 없었어요

translation.en: "What's going on with Kai?"
And it's all, "He killed a 70-something-odd-year-old man."
It's like, "No."
Three months ago, I'm searching for this guy
to put him on television so we can all enjoy him.
Three months later, the police are looking for this guy
translation.ko: 3개월 후엔 경찰이 카이를 찾아 헤매고 있었어요

translation.en: so he can be judged for killing a human being.
translation.ko: 사람을 죽인 죄로 재판을 받게 하려고요

translation.en: [Jessob] Two days later, I still hadn't heard from him.
And then on Tuesday, May 14th, 2013,
Kai posted this on Facebook.
"What would you do if you woke up with a groggy head,
metallic taste in your mouth, in a stranger's house…
walked to the mirror
and seen come dripping from the side of your face
from your mouth, and started retching,
translation.ko: '입가하고 얼굴에서 정액이 뚝뚝 떨어지고' '구역질이 나기 시작해'

translation.en: realizing that someone had drugged, raped, and blown their fucking load in you?"
translation.ko: '알고 보니 누군가 나한테 약을 먹여 강간하고 '나한테 왕창 싸지른 거지'

translation.en: [Alex] And he had this ominous question at the end. "What would you do?"
translation.ko: 마지막엔 이런 불길한 질문이 있죠 '너라면 어쩔래?

translation.en: I remember turning to my wife
and being like, "This guy just killed someone."
What I know of Kai, I know that he has that switch,
translation.ko: 카이가 갑자기 분노하는 면이 있다는 건 알았어요

translation.en: and he has that deep, deep, deep-seated anger and hatred for assault.
translation.ko: 공격 행위에 대한 뿌리 깊은 분노가 있다는 것도요

translation.en: But, I mean, I just don't believe… I don't think he would do something like that for no reason.
translation.ko: 하지만 이유 없이 그런 짓을 할 리는 없다고 생각했어요

translation.en: The manhunt needed to find him as quickly as possible
translation.ko: 수색팀이 최대한 빨리 용의자를 찾아야 했어요

translation.en: to make sure that nobody else got hurt along the way.
translation.ko: 이후에 추가 피해자가 나오는 걸 방지하기 위해서요

translation.en: The investigation revealed there were communications
translation.ko: 수사팀은 케일럽이 젊은 여성과 연락을 주고받은 걸 밝혀냈어요

translation.en: with a young woman that was a fan of his that the task force called Fan Number One.
translation.ko: 수사팀은 케일럽이 젊은 여성과 연락을 주고받은 걸 밝혀냈어요 케일럽의 팬이었는데 수사팀은 '팬 1'이라고 불렀죠

translation.en: And this was somebody who Caleb had met, uh, through Facebook, had communicated with,
translation.ko: 페이스북에서 케일럽을 만나서 연락을 주고받은 여성으로

translation.en: uh, somebody who had expressed interest in hanging out with him.
translation.ko: 케일럽에게 직접 만나고 싶다는 의사를 표현했었죠

translation.en: They had made plans to get together. It was Mother's Day.
Caleb did not follow through on those plans,
and they didn't connect when they were originally supposed to.
We then know that, uh, she did not hear from him until about nine o'clock that night.
translation.ko: 여성은 그날 밤 9시가 돼서야 다시 케일럽의 연락을 받았습니다

translation.en: [John] And he repeatedly started calling and texting her over and over again,
translation.ko: 케일럽은 반복해서 여성에게 전화를 걸고 문자를 보냈습니다

translation.en: asking to be picked up, asking for, uh, transport out of the Clark area.
translation.ko: 차로 태우러 와서 클라크 지역을 떠나게 해달라고요

translation.en: [robotic voice] Your call's been forwarded to an automatic voice message system.
translation.ko: 이 전화는 자동으로 음성 사서함으로 연결됩니다

translation.en: Hey, Kim, this is Kai.
Um, my place fell through.
I was wondering, would you still be able to ride up here?
translation.ko: 혹시 아직 이쪽으로 올 수 있어?

translation.en: Um, it'd be really awesome if you could.
But, yeah, if you could text me back here.
-My phone keeps dying. -[static]
[John] Sunday night into Monday, Caleb was able to make it down from Rahway
translation.ko: 일요일 밤에서 월요일에 걸쳐 케일럽은 로웨이에서부터 애즈버리파크까지 이동했어요

translation.en: to go to Asbury Park.
He met up with Fan Number One. They took some photos together,
and she had told investigators that she was surprised
translation.ko: 여성이 수사관들한테 말하길 케일럽의 외모가 달라져서 놀랐다고 합니다

translation.en: because his appearance was different
from what she knew of his video appearances as well as his Facebook pictures.

I really believe that this guy is innocent.
[man] He goes from hero to wanted man in three months. How should I feel here?
translation.ko: 단 3개월 만에 영웅에서 수배자가 됐어요, 어이 상실이네요

translation.en: [man 2] I want Kai to be free and just going on--
-[man 3] You like the viralness of him. -[man 2] Yeah!

There is a difference between the court of public opinion

Man, I don't know.
I don't know.

translation.ko: 카이가 위험인물인 걸 왜 아무도 몰랐냐고요?

And it wasn't 'cause I wanted to get this guy on TV so bad
translation.ko: 내가 카이를 너무나 간절하게 방송에 출연시키고 싶어서 그랬던 것도 아니고

translation.en: that I believed him, that I was putting down some fear of him,
translation.ko: 내가 카이를 믿었기 때문에 일부러 걱정을 잠재운 것도 아니고

translation.ko: 카이가 내 일에 도움이 되니까 다른 사람의 우려를 무시한 것도 아니에요

translation.en: I can sit here and say I did everything the right way and tried to…
translation.ko: 자신 있게 말할 수 있어요 난 옳은 방법으로…

translation.en: tried to do everything for him and have him be successful and happy
translation.ko: 카이를 위해 최선을 다했고 카이가 성공하고 행복해지길 바랐어요

translation.en: and… I don't know, expose the good in him and hide the bad,
translation.ko: 글쎄요 고의로 카이의 좋은 면만 노출하고 나쁜 점은 숨겼을까요?

translation.en: and I just couldn't, I guess.
No one could, I guess.
[Shirley] In our communication, I've told him before,
if ever he wants me to visit him, I will.
Right now he's said no.
I don't know if I ever will see him again.
translation.ko: 그 애를 다시 볼 수 있을지 모르겠어요

translation.en: [Brad] There's no more home-free. There's no more Dogtown.
There's no more anything, ever.
Your address is gonna be your address forever,
translation.ko: 지금 있는 곳에 쭉 머물게 되겠죠 영원히요

translation.en: and this is a guy who never wanted an address.
translation.ko: 카이는 한곳에 머무는 걸 그렇게나 싫어했는데요

translation.en: Good God.
